problem: A car travels a distance of 100 kilometers in 2 hours. Calculate its average velocity. If a cart with a mass of 10 kg is accelerating at 2 m/s², determine the force applied on the cart. Next, consider a scenario where a car speeds up from 20 km/h to 60 km/h in 5 seconds. Calculate the acceleration of the car. Finally, find the potential energy of a 5 kg object at a height of 10 meters above the ground.

A car travels a distance of 100 kilometers in 2 hours. Calculate its average velocity in km/h. Then, if a cart has a mass of 10 kg and is accelerating at 2 m/s², calculate the force applied to it. Furthermore, if the cart has a velocity of 15 m/s, find its kinetic energy. Lastly, if there is a 5 kg object at a height of 10 meters, calculate its potential energy using the gravitational acceleration of approximately 9.81 m/s².
A car travels a displacement of 100 kilometers in 2 hours. What is the average velocity of the car?
A cart has a mass of 10 kg and is accelerating at 2 m/s². Calculate the force applied on the cart.
